metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15642 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
In lsx_aiffstartread in aiff.c in Sound eXchange (SoX) 14.4.2, there is aUse-After-Free vulnerability triggered by supplying a malformed AIFF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15642` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1
libsox2 - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1
sox - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sox package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1').
